page.title: 06EDUCATION AROUND BRAMHALL.
page.content: There is a wide range of schools in the Bramhall area catering for children from 5 to 18 years. The only secondary school in the area is Bramhall High School, a mixed comprehensive for 11 - 18 year olds with a 9 form entry each year. It has a sixth form of approximately 200 pupils studying for A Level examinations and University entrance. There are 8 schools catering for 5-11 year old pupils. Four of these are primary schools: Ladybrook, Moss Hey, Woodford and Queensgate. Nevill Road and Pownall Green have separate Infant and Junior schools on the same site. There is one special school in the area - the Valley School, which caters for handicapped pupils. Syddal Park Road is a private day school for boys and girls from 3 to 8 years.
